cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ENE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north-to-north-northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New Jersey and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New Jersey coast near Cape May

weather_observation.watch_coast: None – watches confined farther north of North Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI, including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic shoreline from the North Carolina Outer Banks northward through New Jersey, Long Island, and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible as Fay’s western periphery passes well east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge below 2 ft possible along area beaches, mainly near high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–2 inches, brief heavier showers possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents for beach and barge operations
